description:
Sequel to GREAT PRETENDER.

Presumed dead, master con artist and recovering amnesiac Dorothy is discovered by Shanghai Longu-bang, a mob who wants payback for her conning them. With no memories and nowhere to go, she must rely on a local crime underboss to elude Taipei’s criminal underworld all while tracking down leads to her mysterious past.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The movie was screened early in select American theaters on January 9, 2024.
synonyms: グレートプリテンダー ラズブリウト

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
Affiliated with Background Art Company Bamboo.

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mathimekomachi) 

Animation Producer at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Yoshimichi Kameda](https://anilist.co/staff/105635)
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_sadamoto)

Yoshiyuki Sadamoto is an animator, illustrator, character designer, and one of the founding members of studio Gainax.

After college, Sadamoto learned the ropes of key animation under [Yasuo Otsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/136873/Yasuo--Otsuka) at Telecom before becoming a founding member of Gainax. Otsuka later named Sadamoto one of the three men more skillful than him. Though Sadamoto is not an unskilled animator by any means, his reputation rests mainly on his iconic character designs, evident in the reception of the Evangelion cast. Nearly all of Gainax' biggest productions have their characters designed by Sadamoto. He is one of the biggest contributors to the general look of Gainax anime and has proven to be massively influential for character designers of future generations.

Sadamoto's characters are often thin, fragile and have sharp yet understated facial features. He pays a lot of attention to fashion as well.

Most of Sadamoto's influences are mangaka such as [Katsuhiro Otomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Otomo), [Yoshitaka Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/97967/Yoshitaka-Amano), [Kazuo Umezu](https://anilist.co/staff/97777/Kazuo-Umezu), and [Leiji Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97597/Leiji-Matsumoto). Sadamoto would go on to author the Evangelion manga. 

Post-Gainax he has remained active as character designer, mostly for [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/Mamoru-Hosoda)'s popular feature films. He has also focused on different visual and illustration works, as he worked on several manga and is co-creator and character designer for the .hack game franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).
